SENT.plain: The clinical and angiographic findings in a 23-year-old patient with hyperlipoproteinaemia type IV are described
The patient had suffered repeated, transitory attacks of focal cerebral ischaemia
During angiography, occlusion of a branch of the left middle cerebral artery occurred
This was followed by severe neurological deficit, which, however, recovered completely after three days
The pathogenesis of the angiographic findings and of this complication are discussed
